KnowledgeBase.Title: isNull
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: isPositive isOdd isExact isZero isEven isNegative

Function.Description: The isNull function returns true if the specified argumentis #void; otherwise, false is returned.

Brief.Overview: The isNull function returns true if the specified argument {obj} is #void; otherwise, false is returned.
Brief.Usage: The isNull function is used to determine if an object is equal to #void.

Argument.Name: obj
Argument.Note: Must be either a numeric object or a Void Data Type Object.

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the object is Null (equal to #void), otherwise, false is returned otherwise
